intro: Geranium sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Asia and Europe. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems and heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a hardy choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value and adaptability contribute to its popularity in horticulture.
